titleStmt.title: Letters from the great Turke lately sent vnto the holy father the pope and to Rodulphus naming himselfe King of Hungarie, and to all the kinges and princes of Christendome Translated out of the Hebrue tongue into Italian, and out of the Italian into French and now into English out of the French coppie.
titleStmt.author: Turkey. Sultan (1603-1617 : Ahmad I)
Ahmed I, Sultan of the Turks, 1590-1617.

titleStmt.title: Letters from the great Turke lately sent vnto the holy father the pope and to Rodulphus naming himselfe King of Hungarie, and to all the kinges and princes of Christendome Translated out of the Hebrue tongue into Italian, and out of the Italian into French and now into English out of the French coppie.
titleStmt.author: Turkey. Sultan (1603-1617 : Ahmad I)
Ahmed I, Sultan of the Turks, 1590-1617.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Iohn Windet, and are to be sold [by C. Burby] at the white Swan in Pauls-Church yard,

notesStmt.note: The sultan's name is given on B3 recto as Annet Harioson.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.

person.persName: Ahmed Sultan of the Turks, I,
